intro: Psychotria calothyrsa, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria calothyrsa is also known for its psychoactive properties, containing alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
